content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following interconnected production components:
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) using direction UP
– Burner inserter at (1.5, 17.5) (contains fuel: {'coal': 9} and operating with status WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS)
– Assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5) for copper-cable processing

### Belt Depot Assembly at (3.5, 15.5)
Aimed to serve as the transfer target for connected belts:
– Wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as depot
– Transport belt segment positioned at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
– Depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP

### Isolated Belt Target at (–4.5, 18.5)
A standalone placement intended for belt connection:
– Wooden chest located at (–4.5, 18.5)

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Provides the interface for material extraction:
– Burner inserter retrieved at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)

### Electricity Generator at (–0.5, 24.5)
Part of the power production network:
– Steam engine (generator) located at (–0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler positioned at (–5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore pump placed at (–7.5, 25.5)

### Science Lab (Position not specified)
Supports research operations:
– Lab with electrical_id 7106, accepting {'automation-science-pack': 17} and currently in NO_POWER status

### Smelting Facility at approximately (–3.5, 20.0)
Group for processing raw materials via smelting:
– Stone furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) (furnace_result: {'iron-plate': 5})
– Stone furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) (furnace_result: {'copper-plate': 6})
– Wooden chest at (–5.5, 21.5) serving as output storage

ERROR TIPS
──────────
– When connecting transport belts, do not target a steam engine directly. Always add an inserter to serve as the belt’s target to ensure proper item transfer.
– Before placing an entity, verify that the target position is within the permissible placement distance. If the target is too far (e.g. a distance of 15.89 when the max allowed is 10), move closer to the intended position.
– Confirm that the required items are available in inventory prior to placement to avoid “No … in inventory” errors.
– Check that all variables are correctly defined before use to prevent NameError issues (for example, ensure ‘target_chest’ is properly initialized).
